column4: Okay, I was following a guide on how to speed up Ubuntu, and it had me add "profile" to the end of the kernel line in GRUB. What exactly does this do, and can it really speed up my boot time?
:that logs where the time is spend when booting, so you can later look it up and find what's wrong
it records how how long it took to finish each function.
That's what I thought. I don't really care about that stuff too much, so I'll probably just remove it.
